thread.title: NBC’S Sunday Night Football continues to rank high along with local sports lounge
thread.title_full: NBC’S Sunday Night Football continues to rank high along with local sports lounge

title: NBC’S Sunday Night Football continues to rank high along with local sports lounge
text: Share Updated: 2:57 pm LAS VEGAS (KSNV News3LV) -- According to the Nielsen Company, regular season NFL games reached an average of 17.6 million viewers per game in 2014. For the fifth consecutive year in a row, NBC's Sunday Night Football ranked as the most-watched, prime time program during the fall season. Overall, the games averaged 21.3 million viewers. To put things simply, it’s safe to say Americans love football.When it comes to how you watch the game, one local sports lounge continues to score touchdowns when it comes to national lists ranking the best places to catch a game. Lagasse’s Stadium is a restaurant, bar and sports book with has been named "Best Sports Lounge" by Vegas Seven, "Best Sports Bar" by Las Vegas Review-Journal and one of the "Top Sports Bars in Las Vegas" by Yahoo! Sports. Located inside the Palazzo Las Vegas, the restaurant offers unique stadium style seating with food options made by award-winning chefs. There are also over 120 screens throughout the restaurant, making the location a great place for special occasions. Prices range from $50 a person per game to $100 a person per game, depending on the location of seating. Food and drinks are included in the price.
